testcase.name: Cluster IOPS
testcase.preconditions:
1. Cluster is created and healthy

2. Trigger IO traffic to cluster

step.actions:
1. Log in UI and go to Dashboard

2. Check the widget "Cluster IOPS"
step.expectedresults:
1. It should show realistic data of recent 3 hours

2. It refreshes every 1 minute

step.actions:

2. Check the widget "Cluster Throughput"
step.expectedresults:

2. It refreshes every 1 minute

testcase.name: Busy hosts

2. Trigger IO traffic to cluster

step.actions:

2. Check the widget "Busy Hosts"

3. Drill down to check all hosts
step.expectedresults:
1. It should show realistic data of all hosts, and order from the busiest

2. Step3 can drill down to hosts statistics page

testcase.name: Busy virtual storages

2. Trigger IO traffic to cluster

step.actions:

2. Check the widget "Busy Virtual Storages"

3. Drill down to check all virtual storages
step.expectedresults:
1. It should show realistic data of all virtual storages, and order from the busiest

2. Step3 can drill down to virtual storage statistics page

step.actions:
1. Log in UI and go to Dashboard

2. Try to stretch/move/zoom widget
step.expectedresults: 1. Can stretch/move/zoom widget

testcase.name: Cluster IOPS (Historical View)
testcase.preconditions:
1. Cluster is created and healthy

2. Trigger IO traffic to cluster

step.actions:
1. Log in UI and go to Statistic > Cluster page

2. Select "Historical View"

3. Check the widget "Cluster IOPS"
step.expectedresults:
1. Different time range has different resolution:

24 hour <=> minute

1 week <=> hour

1 month <=> hour

1 year <=> day

3 years <=> day

2. The value is in accordance with real traffic

testcase.name: Check latency of Samba protocol
testcase.preconditions:
1. Cluster is created and works well

2. One gateway is created

step.actions:
1. Create CIFS shared folder

2. Access this shared folder from Windows client

3. Use IOMeter to test latency when write files

4. Go to Statistics > Virtual Storage > View by protocol, check widget for latency of samba protocol

5. SSH login gateway node and type "smbstatus -P"

6. Use IOMeter to test latency when read files

7. Go to Statistics > Virtual Storage > View by protocol, check widget for latency of samba protocol

8. SSH login gateway node and type "smbstatus -P"
step.expectedresults:
1. The widget should show correct latency as IOMeter tells

2. The output should be the same as the result of formula below:

Read Latency = (pread_time + read_time) / (pread_count + read_count)

Write Latency = (pwrite_time + write_time) / (pwrite_count + write_count)

The unit of read/write latency is microsecond.

testcase.name: Check latency of NFS protocol
testcase.preconditions:
1. Cluster is created and works well

2. One gateway is created

step.actions:
1. Create NFS shared folder

2. Access this shared folder from Linux client

3. Use Fio to test latency when write files

4. Go to Statistics > Virtual Storage > View by protocol, check widget for latency of NFS protocol

5. SSH login gateway node and type "cat /proc/net/rpc/nfsd"

6. Use Fio to test latency when read files

7. Go to Statistics > Virtual Storage > View by protocol, check widget for latency of NFS protocol

8. SSH login gateway node and type "cat /proc/net/rpc/nfsd"
step.expectedresults:
1. The widget should show correct latency as Fio tells

2. The output should be the same as the result of formula below:

io [Bytes Read] [Bytes Write] [Read OPs] [Write OPs] [Read Time] [Write Time]

Read Latency = [Read Time] / 1000000 / [Read OPs]

Write Latency = [Write Time] / 1000000 / [Write OPs]

The unit of read/write latency is microsecond.

testcase.name: Check latency of iSCSI protocol
testcase.preconditions:
1. Cluster is created and works well

2. One gateway is created

step.actions:
1. Create iSCSI LUN

2. Access this LUN from Linux client

3. Use Fio to test latency when write LUN

4. Go to Statistics > Virtual Storage > View by protocol, check widget for latency of iSCSI protocol

5. SSH login gateway node and type "cat /sys/kernel/scst_tgt/targets/iscsi/[Target Folder]/sessions/[Session ID]/latency" for each iSCSI session

6. Use Fio to test latency when read LUN

7. Go to Statistics > Virtual Storage > View by protocol, check widget for latency of iSCSI protocol

8. SSH login gateway node and type "cat /sys/kernel/scst_tgt/targets/iscsi/[Target Folder]/sessions/[Session ID]/latency" for each iSCSI session
step.expectedresults:
1. The widget should show correct latency as Fio tells

2. The output should be the same as the result of formula below:

Read Latency = [Overall read] / 1000000

Write Latency = [Overall write] / 1000000

Will calculate the average value of all iSCSI sessions

testcase.name: Check latency of FC protocol
testcase.preconditions:
1. Cluster is created and works well

2. The node has FC card

3. One gateway is created

step.actions:
1. Create FC LUN

2. Access this LUN from Linux client

3. Use Fio to test latency when write FC LUN

4. Go to Statistics > Virtual Storage > View by protocol, check widget for latency of FC protocol

5. SSH login gateway node and type "cat /sys/kernel/scst_tgt/targets/iscsi/[Target Folder]/sessions/[Session ID]/latency" for each FC session

6. Use Fio to test latency when read FC LUN

7. Go to Statistics > Virtual Storage > View by protocol, check widget for latency of FC protocol

8. SSH login gateway node and type "cat /sys/kernel/scst_tgt/targets/qla2x00t/[Target Folder]/sessions/[Session ID]/latency" for each FC session
step.expectedresults:
1. The widget should show correct latency as Fio tells

2. The output should be the same as the result of formula below:

Read Latency = [Overall read] / 1000000

Write Latency = [Overall write] / 1000000

Will calculate the average value of all FC sessions

testcase.name: Check historical view of latency for virtual storage
testcase.preconditions:
1. Cluster is created and works well

2. The previous 4 test cases are executed

step.actions:
1. Go to Statistics > Virtual Storage > View by protocol

2. Select historical view, check widget for latency
step.expectedresults: 1. Histoical data are coincident with past tests

testcase.name: System status
testcase.preconditions:
1. Cluster is created and healthy

2. Trigger IO traffic to cluster

step.actions:
1. Go to Statistic > Host Statistics

2. Check realtime status of the following resources:

CPU

MEM

DISK

NET
step.expectedresults: 1. It should reflect the real status of each node

testcase.name: Status indicator
testcase.preconditions: 1. Cluster is created and healthy

step.actions:
1. Go to Statistic > Host Statistics

2. Check realtime status of the following services:

OSD

GW

RAID

HA
step.expectedresults: 1. It should reflect the real status of each node

testcase.name: Check OSD status on host statistic page
testcase.preconditions: 1. Cluster is created and healthy

step.actions:
1. Go to Statistic > Host Statistics

2. Check status of OSD in one host

3. Stop one OSD in this host

4. Go to Statistic > Host Statistics

5. Check status of this OSD

6. Disable all OSDs in this host

7. Go to Statistic > Host Statistics

8. Check status of this OSD
step.expectedresults:
1. Step2 shows OSD indicator is green

2. Step5 shows OSD indicator is red

3. Step8 shows OSD indicator is gray

testcase.name: Check GW status on host statistic page
testcase.preconditions:
1. Cluster is created and healthy

2. Enable gateway in all hosts

step.actions:
1. Go to Statistic > Host Statistics

2. Check status of GW in one host

3. SSH login this host and stop ezfs-agent service

4. Go to Statistic > Host Statistics

5. Check status of this GW

6. Disable the gateway in this host

7. Go to Statistic > Host Statistics

8. Check status of this GW
step.expectedresults:
1. Step2 shows GW indicator is green

2. Step5 shows GW indicator is red

3. Step8 shows GW indicator is gray

testcase.name: Host performance detail (Realtime view)
testcase.preconditions:
1. Cluster is created and healthy

2. Trigger IO traffic to cluster

step.actions:
1. Go to Statistic > Host Statistics

2. Click host IP link to drill down to detail window

3. Select "Realtime View" and check widgets
step.expectedresults: 1. It should reflect the real performance of resources every 10s

testcase.preconditions:
1. Cluster is created and healthy

2. Trigger IO traffic to cluster

step.actions:

2. Click host IP link to drill down to detail window

24 hour <=> minute

1 week <=> hour

testcase.name: Check log when query all
testcase.preconditions: 1. Prepare plenty of logs

step.actions:
1. Go to Cluster > Logs, click button "Query Logs"

2. Select "Query all"

3. Check printed logs
step.expectedresults: 1. It should print all logs

testcase.name: Check log when query by severities
testcase.preconditions: 1. Prepare logs with different severities

step.actions:
1. Go to Cluster > Logs, click button "Query Logs"

2. Select "Query by severities"

3. Select different severities

4. Check printed logs
step.expectedresults: 1. It should print logs with corresponding severities

testcase.name: Check log when query by categories
testcase.preconditions: 1. Prepare logs with different categories

step.actions:
1. Go to Cluster > Logs, click button "Query Logs"

2. Select "Query by categories"

3. Select different categories

4. Check printed logs
step.expectedresults: 1. It should print logs with corresponding categories

testcase.name: Check log when query by events
testcase.preconditions: 1. Prepare plenty of logs

step.actions:
1. Go to Cluster > Logs, click button "Query Logs"

2. Select "Query by events"

3. Select different categories

4. Multiple select some events

5. Click query and check printed logs
step.expectedresults: 1. It should print logs with corresponding events

testcase.name: Can drill down the details of logs

step.actions:
1. Trigger slow request logs

2. Go to Cluster->Logs page

3. Click "Query Logs" button

4. Select "Cluster Monitoring"->"Slow Request"

5. Click "Query" button

6. Click details link of the log
step.expectedresults: 1. Should show detailed info of this log

testcase.name: UI pops float window for events

step.actions:
1. Go to Virtual Storages->NAS page

2. Create a new NAS folder

3. Check UI
step.expectedresults: 1. There is a float window poping up and it should show corrct info and time

testcase.name: Check if notify after EXT4 error

step.actions:
1. Use dd to ruin filesystem to trigger EXT4 error

2. Check if there is notification event in UI
step.expectedresults: 1. There is notification of EXT4 error in UI

testcase.name: Check if it has high severity event after EXT4 error

step.actions:
1. Use dd to ruin filesystem to trigger EXT4 error

2. Go to Cluster > Logs page

3. Query logs with "error" severity
step.expectedresults: 1. It should query out EXT4 error logs

testcase.name: UI should show WARNING and ERROR logs by default
testcase.preconditions: 1. Prepare WARNING and ERROR logs

step.actions:
1. Go to Cluster > Logs

2. Check logs display by default
step.expectedresults: 1. UI should show WARNING and ERROR logs by default

testcase.name: It should flush ezcentral.cache into rados when open Logs page

step.actions:
1. Logout and login web UI

2. Check log /var/log/ezcloudstor/ezcentral.cache

3. Go to Cluster > Logs page

4. Check log /var/log/ezcloudstor/ezcentral.cache
step.expectedresults: 1. It should flush ezcentral.cache into rados

testcase.name: Save log if select "Export queried log to a zip file"
testcase.preconditions: 1. Prepare plenty of logs

step.actions:
1. Go to Cluster > Logs, click button "Query Logs"

2. Select "Query all"

3. Select "Export queried log to a zip file"

4. Check exported log
step.expectedresults: 1. It should save the related log as zip file

testcase.name: Filename input check (Too long, too short, invalid value)
testcase.preconditions: 1. Prepare plenty of logs

step.actions:
1. Go to Cluster > Logs, click button "Query Logs"

2. Select "Query all"

3. Select "Export queried log to a zip file" and input name with length of 65

4. Select "Export queried log to a zip file" and input name with length of 5

5. Select "Export queried log to a zip file" and input name "中文名字"
step.expectedresults:
1. It should not allow user to input those invalid names

2. Only allow 6-64 byte, a-z, A-Z, - and _

testcase.name: Check "Exported logs"
testcase.preconditions: 1. Prepare plenty of logs

step.actions:
1. Go to Cluster > Logs, click button "Query Logs"

2. Select "Query all"

3. Select "Export queried log to a zip file"

4. Check the table columns of "Exported logs": Create Time, Export Name, Size

5. Query all logs with some severities

6. Select "Export queried log to a zip file"

7. Check the table columns of "Exported logs": Create Time, Export Name, Size
step.expectedresults: 1. The table shows right values for the zip files

testcase.name: Download log zip file
testcase.preconditions: 1. Prepare plenty of logs

step.actions:
1. Go to Cluster > Logs, click button "Query Logs"

2. Select "Query all"

3. Select "Export queried log to a zip file"

4. Download exported log
step.expectedresults: 1. The downloaded zip file includes all logs

testcase.name: Check log in zip file
testcase.preconditions: 1. Prepare plenty of logs

step.actions:
1. Go to Cluster > Logs, click button "Query Logs"

2. Select "Query all"

3. Select "Export queried log to a zip file"

4. Download exported log

5. Check log files in zip

6. Check all columns in logs
step.expectedresults:
1. The logs are the same as query result from UI

2. The logs inlude below columns:

log_time

log_level

log_host

log_category

log_event

log_id

log_data

testcase.name: Delete log zip file
testcase.preconditions: 1. Prepare plenty of logs

step.actions:
1. Go to Cluster > Logs, click button "Query Logs"

2. Select "Query all"

3. Select "Export queried log to a zip file"

4. Delete exported log
step.expectedresults: 1. The exported zip file is deleted
